definition: to remember old friends/to cherish old friendships/for old time's sake

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
do not recall old grievances (idiom, from Analects); forgive and forget

sentences.english: You always live like a scavenger.
sentences.chinese: 念舊的人總活得像個拾荒者。

sentences.english: I am a bit too, and habits of the things is not willing to lose.
sentences.chinese: 我就是太念舊，習慣的東西不捨得丟。

sentences.english: More than I can be with you, I have been in love with you.
sentences.chinese: 我比想象中要念舊，我一直都在愛著你。

sentences.english: If he truly loves you, he'll forgive and forget.
sentences.chinese: 如果他真的愛你，他會不念舊惡的。

sentences.english: I am nostalgic, because I do not see you and the future.
sentences.chinese: 我念舊，由於我看不到你和將來。

sentences.english: Every time i eat this, it would arouse nostalgia within me.
sentences.chinese: 每一次一喫這種食物，我的內心就生起一股念舊來。

sentences.english: Let's forgive and forget and cooperate to make the new venture a success.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們不念舊惡，配合起來使新的事業取得成功。

sentences.english: Don't hold grudges against people who have hurt you; you should forgive and forget.
sentences.chinese: 不要怨恨那些傷害過你的人，你應該不念舊惡。

sentences.english: Forget when, begin to love you.
sentences.chinese: 忘了從什麼時候，開始喜歡念舊。

sentences.english: I forget the past, I indulged in the past, all the good memory of the past.
sentences.chinese: 我念舊，我沉溺過去，懷念以前的一切美好。

sentences.english: People who are nostalgic are always lovely.
But the power of nostalgia doesn't depend on the times you live in.
sentences.chinese: 但念舊的力量與你生活在什麼時代是無關的。

sentences.english: In that way , your previous boyfriend will think he won't lose face, miss his past lover, and very capable.
sentences.chinese: 那樣只能使男人覺得自己很有面子很念舊情很有辦法。

sentences.english: I was so NianJiu, accustomed to things not willing to lose.
sentences.chinese: 我就是太念舊，習慣的東西不捨得丟。

definition: lit. to like the new, and hate the old (idiom); fig. enamored with new people (e.g. new girlfriend), bored with the old
to be softhearted/to be tenderhearted/to be kindhearted
to like to look good in the eyes of others/sensitive about how one is regarded by others/proud
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
to remain silent/to have nothing to say/(coll.) speechless/dumbfounded
